headline: CARR Q1 Earnings Call: Management Prioritizes Product Innovation, Cost Controls, and Tariff Mitigation
summary: Heating, ventilation, air conditioning, and refrigeration company Carrier Global (NYSE:CARR) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q1 CY2025, but sales fell by 3.7% year on year to $5.22 billion. The company’s full-year revenue guidance of $23 billion at the midpoint came in 1.5% above analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.65 per share was 10.9% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Carrier Global (NYSE:CARR) Invests Additional US$1 Billion in U.S. Expansion and Innovation
summary: Carrier Global (NYSE:CARR) recently announced a significant $1 billion investment plan aimed at expanding U.S. manufacturing and workforce, potentially impacting its share price by 26% over the last month. This boost aligns with the company's strategy to enhance R&D and create thousands of jobs, adding weight to the broader market rally where the Dow and Nasdaq rose amid eased U.S.-China tariffs and a positive inflation report. Additionally, Carrier's improved earnings, revised 2025 guidance,...
